meanings.definition: A typically open-air seating area consisting of rows of benches or seats, often found in sports stadiums or theaters.
meanings.sent1: The fans cheered loudly from the bleacher.
meanings.sent2: I sat on the bleacher to watch the baseball game.
meanings.sent3: The sunburnt man found shade under the bleacher.
meanings.sent4: The bleacher stretched out like a long snake in the stadium.
meanings.sent5: The colorful bleacher stood out against the green field.

meanings.definition: A person who bleaches cloth or other materials.
meanings.sent1: The bleacher carefully whitened the fabric.
meanings.sent2: She hired a bleacher to lighten her old curtains.
meanings.sent3: The bleacher accidentally spilled bleach on his shoes.
meanings.sent4: Her job as a bleacher made everything look brand new.
meanings.sent5: The bleacher's hands were always covered in bleach stains.

meanings.sent1: The factory installed a new bleacher for faster production.
meanings.sent2: The bleacher efficiently cleaned the stained clothes.
meanings.sent3: The old bleacher broke down during the laundry cycle.
meanings.sent4: The powerful bleacher removed all tough stains easily.
meanings.sent5: The sparkling white sheets came out of the bleacher.
